Package main.model

Class GridGameAbstract

java.lang.Object
main.model.GridGameAbstract
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGridGame
Direct Known Subclasses:
GridGame5D, GridGame5T
public abstract class GridGameAbstract
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGridGame
This class represent a model of Morpion Solitaire.

    • isAligned

      protected boolean isAligned​(int x, int y, int alignmentNumber, int nbPointAlreadyAligned)
      Check if an alignment of 'alignmentNumber' length with a certain number of Points already aligned exists.
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate checked
      y - coordinate checked
      alignmentNumber -
      nbPointAlreadyAligned -
      Returns:
      true if the alignment is correct.

    • placePoint

      protected void placePoint​(int x, int y, int alignmentNumber, int nbPointAlreadyAligned)
      This method allows to place a point in the grid thanks to the x and y coordinates given in argument. We use the isAligned() method to know if the point is really aligned with others points, and the method add it to the grid. If the point is not aligned or if the point is already contained in the grid, the method do nothing.
      Parameters:
      x -
      y -
      alignmentNumber -
      nbPointAlreadyAligned -

    • getPossiblePoint

      public java.util.Set<Point> getPossiblePoint​(int nbPointForAlign, int nbPointsAlreadyALigned)
      We go through each of the potential neighbors of our points. We look for each of them if they can allow an alignment. If so, they are added to the set.
      Returns:
      All the points that can be played by the player thanks to isAligned() method.

    • randomSolve

      public void randomSolve()
      This method selects randomly a point among the possible point that can be played, as long there is an eligible point.
      Specified by:
      randomSolve in interface IGridGame

      public void restartGame()
      Specified by:

    • cancelPlay

      public void cancelPlay()
      This method cancel the last Point placed. We need to remove the last Point played, its last alignment, and the direction (alignment direction) of the Points of the last alignments.
      Specified by:
      cancelPlay in interface IGridGame
